message:
Hezbollah released a video last night documenting the drone attack on the artillery headquarters at the Khirbet Ma'ar base.

Sources associated with the Shiite axis claim that an Iranian Shahad 101 UAV was used in the attack and add that the innovation this time is that it has an electric motor that is powered by batteries and not a gasoline engine as was the case in the past.
According to these sources, an electric motor does have a shorter range, but it is quieter and emits less heat, so it is more difficult to detect.
Regarding the short range, these sources stated that the short distance between the launch point and the target in this arena is perfectly suited for the electric motor.
The Palestinians report casualties as a result of parachute aid that fell a short time ago on displaced persons' tents near Al-Aqsa University in Gaza City.

Regarding the circumstances in which the APC was damaged in which 8 fighters fell yesterday in Rafah, I will note that the military wing of Hamas claimed yesterday at noon that in the early morning hours its men ambushed the maneuvering forces in the Saudi neighborhood in West Rafah, in which Hamas operatives fired a Yassin 105 rocket (a type of RPG) at The operating compartment of the D9 bulldozer. According to them, when the APC arrived in order to rescue the victims in the D9, another "Yassin 105" was fired at the APC, which caused it to explode.
Kia, original owner, Gaza. A few scratches.

Further to this, the IDF spokesperson:

The IDF makes it clear that there is no cessation of hostilities in the southern Gaza Strip, and the battles in Rafah continue. Also, there is no change in the introduction of goods into the Gaza Strip. The axis carrying the goods will be open during the day in coordination with international organizations, for the transportation of humanitarian aid only.
The president of Chechnya, Kadyrov, arrived in Saudi Arabia yesterday to observe the Hajj.

Jenin: Channels affiliated with Hamas and the Islamic Jihad in Jenin call on the military operatives not to visit the cemeteries, as is customary for the holiday, and not to appear openly because the IDF drones are gathering information about them especially at this time.

Viewer warning: graphic images of sheep slaughter in the Gaza Strip for the holiday.

The children stand on the sidelines and watch the act of slaughter, some not yet of school age. Others play with the heads of the sheep after the slaughter. This is an annual event in the Strip.
The holiday prayer at the Temple Mount this morning.
Photos from the morning holiday prayer at the great mosque in Gaza City - al Amri Mosque.

Palestinian channels:

#صور | من صلاة العيد في يافا المحتلة

"Photos from the prayer (Holiday of Sacrifice - AA) in occupied Jaffa."

The sign in the picture reads: The innocent in Gaza (are) in the heart of Jaffa.
Stop the war!

The IDF spokesperson in Arabic announced this morning the suspension of offensive activities every day until further notice between eight in the morning and seven in the evening along the route marked on the attached map, which connects the Kerem Shalom crossing in the south of the Gaza Strip and the European Hospital in Khan Yunis, in order to facilitate the introduction of humanitarian aid into the Gaza Strip.

According to the IDF spokesperson, the move was formulated with UN officials in order to help the humanitarian efforts in the field.
The change went into effect yesterday, according to the publication.

The IDF spokesperson published the names of 7 IDF soldiers who fell in the battles in the Gaza Strip.

5 of them fell in the APC disaster in Rafah in the south of the Gaza Strip (there are two other names that have not yet been published) and two of them fell in another incident in the north of the Gaza Strip.

May their memories be a blessing.
